intro: Licania leucosepala, commonly known as the white-seeded licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and numerous stamens. Licania leucosepala produces small, round fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind and animals.
